metadata.title: CVE-2020-28368 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Xen through 4.14.x allows guest OS administrators to obtain sensitiveinformation (such as AES keys from outside the guest) via a side-channelattack on a power/energy monitoring interface, aka a "Platypus" attack.NOTE: there is only one logically independent fix: to change the accesscontrol for each such interface in Xen.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1

libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
